duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage and support the Tooling Department, overseeing staff and supporting new programs development.
Ensure safety and risk reduction while focusing on team improvements and tooling fabrication and repair goals.
Maintain workflow and productivity by managing process steps, monitoring resources, and implementing cost reductions and corrections.
Foster cooperation within and between departments, addressing production and inspection tooling needs in a timely manner.
Establish and enforce organization standards, maintain fabrication methods, and ensure tool fabrication schedules.
Collaborate with department/area Engineers and Supervisors, and Program Managers to ensure the progress and completion of new tooling builds.
Partner with the Tool Check department on in-house and Vendor Tooling repairs, and educate and direct employees on the safe use of equipment and resources.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or relative field (Master's preferred)
